newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end up on short covering.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end up on short covering.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished higher on Wednesday amid covering of short positions by speculators, but dealers said they expected the sentiment to remain mixed on Thursday on lack of support from major players.

The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index rose 3.77 points, or 0.26 percent, to end at 1,426.84. Losers led gainers 151 to 67. Turnover fell to 22.53 million shares from 24.59 million on Tuesday.
Most activity was speculative as major players were on the sidelines because of a lack of confidence-building news, dealers said.
"The index recovered slightly but we expect the market to be mixed tomorrow," analyst Salman Rasheed of Fortune Securities said.
Muslim Commercial Bank rose 1.35 rupees to 32.85 and Adamjee Insurance 6.50 to 89. Hub Power Co rose 0.35 to 29.15 and Pakistan State Oil 10 to 335. PTCL rose 0.25 to 35.05.
